author: Odeinoichus
title: Join Andrea on her Hike
review:
Set #41031 Andrea’s Mountain Hut: LEGO Friends brings us another interesting looking set from late 2014. This is one of few sets that doesn’t fit in with the Jungle Rescue Theme. And it’s a really neat little set, read on to find out my thoughts on this set.

Box/Instructions

Box: My thoughts on the Friends box designs are well known from countless other reviews. This box design has been so well received I feel that it hardly changes much from year to year. I will say though that it might be nice to see them make a different colour for the sub-themes.

Instructions: The same could be said of these. Not much to say aside from their easy to follow steps and the usual cross-promotional images in the back. Standard instructions from these sets.

Parts

Love the parts in this set, loads of purple and pink pieces and a light brown cross piece. It’s a great new piece that has tons of uses. You only get one in this set though, which I suppose that makes it a bit rare.

Minifigures

Andrea:  This version of Andrea is wearing a nice light-blue top with some floral printing and a pair of light purple pants… Or perhaps they’re dark rose. It’s a nice combination and I like the look of her ‘camp-out’ uniform. She includes a red mug, a printed map tile from the Pirates Theme, a camera and of course the marshmallow on a stick which is fun.

Really fun looking Mini-Doll in this set.

The build

In this set you’re building three things. Two mini-models and one main model. The build is quick and easy for the mini-models and really fun for the main model. There are no stickers in this set and no numbered bags, so you’re basically separating the pieces from the bags before you start the building.

The hanging lamp is a fun micro-build. The technique has been used in other sets, however the real fun is making the little hut because the walls are nice and solid. You won’t find any difficult steps in this set though.

The completed model

The mountain hut is an awesome looking model. It’s a three-sided open air building that is more of a place to sit and keep yourself dry from the rain while out camping in the mountains. You can sit your mini-doll either on the dark rose bench outside or the orange bed on the inside. There’s a small stool for the squirrel included inside the set next to some flowers on a small green plate.

The campfire is a simple little build and Andrea seems to be boiling some water to cook with, as inside of the pot is a clear stud.

Overall opinion

Overall I really dig this set. It’s a nice little set from summer 2014 and includes an impressive model with a lot of potential fun for playing with. There aren’t a tone of gimmicky features, but that’s the beauty of the set. This is more of a little camp site where Andrea goes on the side of Heartlake Mountain. It isn’t meant to be an exciting gimmick loaded set. So I’m going to strongly recommend picking up this set, it’s really fun to play with and fun to build.
